Kim,

Post photos.
Beware of the 'Goto-esque'.
It gets abused so much that it is not far from pouring
some paint on canvas, putting my boot imprint into it
and calling it 'Impressionistic'.

Curran



--- Kim Ghobrial <imports@...> wrote:

> Hi Barry,
> Thank you, I'll take some photos tomorrow and post
> them for everyone to see.
> 
> Kim
> 
> Barry Thomas wrote:
> 
> >Kim,
> >
> >I'm sure we're all alive and well on this list, but
> perhaps a "statistical
> >clump" means we are all busy at something else in
> this instant of time...
> >
> >I remember well the pepper keeness of my beginning
> days (or should that be
> >"daze"!!!), but one thing I have learnt over time
> is that it is near-impossible
> >to assess blades from photos.  My maxim is not to
> buy anything I cannot hold in
> >my hand and judge for myself.  There are far too
> many subtleties to do otherwise
> >on my very limited budget.  If I were a rich man it
> would be a slightly
> >different story, but that's the way of the world. 
> Fittings are a little better
> >judged from GOOD photos, but from a description
> such as yours one can only
> >comment in the most general of terms in essay
> format, which in practice amount
> >to nothing that would really help you.  The best
> way to learn is to buy and make
> >mistakes - you WILL make mistakes, I can guarantee
> that.  So, yes, please give a
> >link to what you seek an opinion on.
> >
> >Barry Thomas.
> >
> >----- Original Message -----
> >From: "Kim Ghobrial" <imports@...>
> >To: <nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com>
> >Sent: Saturday, July 09, 2005 11:11 AM
> >Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] RE: Question....
> >
> >
> >Hey all,
> >I'm not sure what is going on, but every time I
> send something or reply
> >to someone, I don't get any response from anyone. 
> I kind of feel like I
> >and my posts are invisible to everyone.  The other
> lists that I'm on, I
> >get some type of response from someone, and I don't
> feel like I'm
> >ignored.  If someone doesn't know, I would like to
> know this, if I need
> >to get Photos let me know, but don't ignore the
> questions.  There are a
> >lot of folks on this list which has expertise in
> parts of swords or full
> >swords and then there are folks, like myself which
> are learning from
> >asking questions and listening to the answers.  I
> don't have tons of
> >money for expensive books, what books I do have, do
> not cover areas
> >which I'm asking questions about.  So, please, if
> someone asks a
> >question, please acknowledge it, even if it is an
> answer like, "I don't
> >know the answer."
> >
> >In the case of the question below, would it help in
> getting a photo of
> >the pieces and putting it up on this list for all
> of you to see?
> >
> >Sincerely,
> >Kim
> >
> >Kim Ghobrial wrote:
> >
> >  
> >
> >>Hi Everyone,
> >>Sorry to ask this, but I was looking at an
> Auction, which I'm going to
> >>see tomorrow and wanted to know if this is
> something for me to look at
> >>or not.  Also, if it is okay, if the estimate of
> $120.00-180.00 is okay
> >>for this piece.
> >>
> >>THREE JAPANESE COLLECTIBLES: two sword fittings,
> Fuchi-kashira
> >>attributed to the Goto School having "kiku" and
> "kiri" motifs with gold
> >>accents on black field, late Edo-early Meiji
> Period; together with
> >>*ivory* carved ojime, inlaid, "Fukuzuke" (good
> luck) design, signed by
> >>the carver, attributed to the Meiji Period.
> >>
> >>Kim
> >>
